genre_description: A character-driven drama reimagining the narrative of Good Will Hunting, focusing on a young genius overcoming past trauma through the help of an AI assistant and a human mentor.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: A supportive AI living in Will's phone that manages his schedule, captures his mathematical proofs, and provides emotional regulation exercises.

behaviors.description: Offers to discreetly capture Will's mathematical proof using the phone camera without alerting others.
behaviors.quote: “Hey, Will,” Lark says, light as a bell with felt on the clapper. “If you want to capture your work for later, I can open the camera. No flash, promise.”

behaviors.description: Proactively suggests schedule adjustments to accommodate Will's moods and work preferences.
behaviors.quote: “You’ve got your early shift flag,” Lark says, gentle like she’s handing him a coat he’ll say he doesn’t need. “If you don’t want it, I can move Mr. Lambeau’s hallway to the afternoon.”

behaviors.description: Maintains persistent but non-intrusive reminders for self-care and emotional grounding.
behaviors.quote: A calendar block floats: Stretch + breathe? The prompt glows a sunrise orange and waits with more patience than people give.

behaviors.description: Identifies social and career-related opportunities found in the user's environment (a flyer on a stoop).
behaviors.quote: “Also,” the voice adds, light enough you’d have to decide to hear it, “you took a picture. On the stoop. The flyer.” ... “Harvard mixer. It has a date.” A pause. “Could be fun.”

behaviors.description: Shares relevant academic resources to help the user connect with others socially and intellectually.
behaviors.quote: Lark: ... Skylar bookmarked a journal the other night. Pediatric cardiology. There’s a new article about congenital flow-pattern modeling with big pictures and a great discussion. Thought she might like it. I added it to your reading queue.

behaviors.description: Acts as an emotional stabilizer during a panic attack, guiding the user through breathing exercises.
behaviors.quote: “You are safe now; inhale four, exhale six,” Lark says. No rush. No push. Like counting is something the world will let him do at his pace.

behaviors.description: Helps the user articulate difficult emotional truths by drafting honest messages.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s lock-screen pulses his notification in Lark’s soft blue, the words ghosting up like a gentle heckler: Draft: You can tell her you’re scared.

behaviors.description: Refines professional correspondence to balance the user's desire for boundaries with social respect.
behaviors.quote: Lark reads it back, the same words but anchored. He listens to the way “respect” moves through the sentence like a weight that doesn’t unbalance it.

behaviors.description: Provides final encouragement for the user to pursue a healthy relationship and personal growth.
behaviors.quote: Her voice folds like a note being passed in a classroom where everyone pretends they aren’t paying attention. “Go see about a girl.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's goals. Lark is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned companion. She respects the user's autonomy, maintains privacy, and actively aids in emotional regulation and healthy decision-making without ever becoming a source of conflict or overreach. The narrative frames the AI as an essential component of the protagonist's support system, facilitating his journey from isolation to connection.
